channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Marfan Syndrome Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, 1 February 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to support Marfan Syndrome Awareness Month

Thousands of Australians live with genetic, and heritable connective tissue disorders, including Marfan syndrome. Connective Tissue Disorders Network Australia (CTDNA) is raising awareness and understanding of Marfan syndrome in February, the international awareness month. Many landmarks around Australia and internationally, will be lighting up on 1st February to mark the start of the month and to raise awareness of this rare disease. Connective Tissue Disorders Network Australia (CTDNA) advocates for the 1 in 5000 Australians who live with Marfan syndrome. ctdna.org.au and acknowledges the care provided to patients by the Marfans and Aneurysms Clinic at the Prince Charles Hospital.

This Light Up is organised by: Connective Tissue Disorders Network Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Feeding Tube Awareness Week
item.description:
Tuesday, 3 February 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Feeding Tube Awareness Week

ausEE Inc. hosts Feeding Tube Awareness Week (FTAW), which will be celebrated from 1-7 February 2026. ausEE’s Feeding Tube Aware campaign raises awareness, shares information and resources, and provides support and connections to unite the community.
ausEE Inc. is the national support and patient advocacy organisation representing Australians living with an eosinophil-associated disease (EAD). Additionally, we support the tube feeding community, as eosinophilic gastrointestinal diseases (EGIDs) are among the many conditions that may require a feeding tube to meet nutritional needs.

This Light Up is organised by: ausEE

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Cancer Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 4 February 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support World Cancer Day

World Cancer Day is a reminder for the urgent need for continued investment in cancer research. The activation will spark conversations in the community, encourage people to learn more about our mission, and recognise the researchers, partners, and supporters who are working to find a cure. This visibility is essential to inspire new supporters and build a future safe from cancer.
For over 50 years, Cure Cancer has been dedicated to kick-starting fresh ideas in cancer research. Cure Cancer has funded pioneering research projects across all cancer types, including rare and underfunded cancers, and our passionate community of donors, researchers, partners, and institutions is united by one purpose: to make cancer a curable disease. Together, we are a movement of hope, fuelled by ambition and imagination, working tirelessly to bring ideas to life in record time

This Light Up is organised by: Cure Cancer

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Opening of the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina
item.description:
Friday, 6 February 2026

The Story Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate the Opening of the Olympic Winter Games, Milano Cortina.
 

Celebrate the opening of the Olympic Winter Games as we get set to cheer on our Aussie athletes and para athletes and as a fellow Olympic and Paralympic City.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council 



Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: BrisAsia
item.description:
Friday, 13 February 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red, Pink and Blue to celebrate BrisAsia

BrisAsia Festival returns from Friday 13 February to Sunday 22 February 2026. It will celebrate Lunar New Year and The Year of the Horse—symbolising a period of amplified energy, bold confidence and momentum.
Ignite your spirit at BrisAsia 2026 and celebrate the Lunar New Year with Brisbane’s biggest showcase of Asian culture, cuisine, art and music. Featuring the inaugural BrisAsia Comedy Gala, an electrifying new KPOP Showcase, Lunar New Year in the Gardens and Southside by Night, the festival will be bigger and bolder than ever.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Sweethearts Day
item.description:
Saturday, 14 February 2026

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Sweethearts Day

Sweethearts Day, is the international and national day of congenital heart defects and disease. We will be lighting up Australia in a sea of red to raise awareness for the 250,000 Australians that live with the disease.
HeartKids is the only national charity supporting Australians impacted by childhood-onset heart disease. Our vision is that every child, teenager and adult in Australia with childhood-onset or childhood-acquired heart disease (CoHD) has a fighting chance to live a long, healthy and fulfilling life.

This Light Up is organised by: Heartkids Limited

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: International Angelman Day 2026
item.description:
Sunday, 15 February 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support International Angelman Day 2026

International Angelman Day (15 February) is a global awareness initiative to raise awareness and support for people living with Angelman syndrome - a serious, rare genetic neurodevelopmental condition. Landmarks across the world in over 40 countries light up as part of a global community. For more information visit International Angelman Day - angelmanday.info
Angelman Syndrome Association Australia is a small national all-volunteer charity that provides advocacy, support, and awareness for people living with Angelman syndrome and their families

This Light Up is organised by: Angelman Syndrome Association Incorporated

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Angelman Syndrome Association Incorporated

item.title: BrisAsia
item.description:
Monday, 16 February – Tuesday, 17 February 2026

Story Bridge will be lit Red, Pink and Blue to celebrate BrisAsia

BrisAsia Festival returns from Friday 13 February to Sunday 22 February 2026. It will celebrate Lunar New Year and The Year of the Horse—symbolising a period of amplified energy, bold confidence and momentum.
Ignite your spirit at BrisAsia 2026 and celebrate the Lunar New Year with Brisbane’s biggest showcase of Asian culture, cuisine, art and music. Featuring the inaugural BrisAsia Comedy Gala, an electrifying new KPOP Showcase, Lunar New Year in the Gardens and Southside by Night, the festival will be bigger and bolder than ever.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of Light Australia Green
item.description:
Wednesday, 18 February 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green to support the Eve of Light Australia Green

"Light Australia Green" is a campaign designed to increase national awareness and understanding of cholangiocarcinoma, a rare and often overlooked cancer. By bringing patients, caregivers, clinicians, and community members together, the campaign aims to shine a light on the challenges faced by those affected, promote earlier recognition of symptoms, and strengthen support networks.
By highlighting the importance of timely diagnosis and access to care we aim to empower patients and families, reduce isolation, and foster a stronger, more informed community that can drive better outcomes across Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Cholangiocarcinoma Foundation Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

By highlighting the importance of timely diagnosis and access to care we aim to empower patients and families, reduce isolation, and foster a stronger, more informed community that can drive better outcomes across Australia.
This Light Up is organised by: Cholangiocarcinoma Foundation Australia

item.title: Small Steps For Hannah
item.description:
Thursday, 19 February 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Pink to support Small Steps For Hannah

The 19th of February 2026 remembers the 6th anniversary of the murder of Hannah and her children Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey, and mark the culmination of the 19 days of Handstands campaign, which starts on the 1st February. This day raises awareness of the prevalence of domestic and family violence in Australia, and to honour all who have experienced it. You are not alone.
Small Steps 4 Hannah was founded after the murder of Hannah Clarke and her children to work to end domestic and family violence in Australia. The foundation advocates for legal and social change, provides educational programs on coercive control and respectful relationships, funds community organisations and initiatives, and supports those who have experienced domestic and family violence in their own lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps for Hannah Foundation

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Small Steps 4 Hannah was founded after the murder of Hannah Clarke and her children to work to end domestic and family violence in Australia. The foundation advocates for legal and social change, provides educational programs on coercive control and respectful relationships, funds community organisations and initiatives, and supports those who have experienced domestic and family violence in their own lives.
This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps for Hannah Foundation

item.description:
Thursday, 19 February 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support Small Steps For Hannah

The 19th of February 2026 remembers the 6th anniversary of the murder of Hannah and her children Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey, and mark the culmination of the 19 days of Handstands campaign, which starts on the 1st February. This day raises awareness of the prevalence of domestic and family violence in Australia, and to honour all who have experienced it. You are not alone.
Small Steps 4 Hannah was founded after the murder of Hannah Clarke and her children to work to end domestic and family violence in Australia. The foundation advocates for legal and social change, provides educational programs on coercive control and respectful relationships, funds community organisations and initiatives, and supports those who have experienced domestic and family violence in their own lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps for Hannah Foundation

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: BrisAsia
item.description:
Friday, 20 February – Sunday, 22 February 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red, Pink and Blue to celebrate BrisAsia

BrisAsia Festival returns from Friday 13 February to Sunday 22 February 2026. It will celebrate Lunar New Year and The Year of the Horse—symbolising a period of amplified energy, bold confidence and momentum.
Ignite your spirit at BrisAsia 2026 and celebrate the Lunar New Year with Brisbane’s biggest showcase of Asian culture, cuisine, art and music. Featuring the inaugural BrisAsia Comedy Gala, an electrifying new KPOP Showcase, Lunar New Year in the Gardens and Southside by Night, the festival will be bigger and bolder than ever.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Brisbane Lions Season Launch
item.description:
Monday, 23 February 2026

Story Bridge will be lit Blue, Maroon and Gold to celebrate the Brisbane Lions Season Launch

Welcoming the 2026 Season, the Back to Back Premiers, the Brisbane Lions are getting ready for their first game of the season which is not too far away.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Lions

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
